title: WCAS EARTH 450-0-1 Advanced Topics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Through reading, discussion, writing and peer critique, this course will explore strategies for successful scientific communication beyond academia. How can scientists break through barriers to understanding and foster engagement with scientific information, while still conveying nuance and uncertainty? What happens when science becomes politicized and controversial? This seminar is open to graduate students in all STEM disciplines, with preference to students who have begun to conduct independent research.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: This course is intended for Graduate students ONLY.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Readings will be a coursepack, plus two books:

Don't Be Such a Scientist: Talking Substance in an Age of Style by Randy Olson. Island Press 2009, ISBN-10: 1597265632, ISBN-13: 978-1597265638. (Approx. $20 new, $8 used).

Writing Science in Plain English by Anne E. Greene. U of Chicago Press 2013.ISBN: 9780226026374 (paperback). (Approx. $15 new).
